title: Calories in a Chipotle Steak Bowl
meta_description: Discover calories in a Chipotle steak bowl, including protein, carbs, fat, full nutrition breakdown, and customization tweaks for your burrito bowl.
h1: Calories in a Chipotle Steak Bowl
assumptions: Standard Chipotle burrito bowl with adobo-marinated steak, brown rice, black beans, fajita veggies, tomato salsa, cheese, lettuce, and sour cream; no guacamole or extras.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by customization, portion size, location, and preparation; Chipotle values can change—check their app or site for latest.

quick_answer.text: A standard Chipotle steak bowl contains about 665 kcal, 40 g protein, and 70 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Skip the sour cream and cheese

faqs.q: How many calories in a Chipotle steak bowl without rice?
faqs.a: Removing rice cuts about 200 kcal, bringing it to ~465 kcal.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a Chipotle steak bowl?
faqs.a: Approximately 40 g of protein from the steak, beans, and cheese.
No, with ~70 g carbs mainly from rice and beans; opt for no rice for lower carbs.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in a Chipotle steak bowl?
faqs.a: Around 1500 mg, mostly from seasoning, beans, and salsa.

faqs.q: Can I make a Chipotle steak bowl lower in calories?
faqs.a: Yes—skip cheese, sour cream, and rice to reduce by 300+ kcal.
